text: While analyzing the status of the project, the project manager calculated the ratio between earned value EV and planned value PV and found that the ratio is 1.13. He was not satisfied and decided to crash some critical path activities by adding more resources to these activities as a corrective action. Is his decision correct?
explanation: The schedule performance index (SPI) is a measure of schedule efficiency expressed as the ratio of earned value to planned value. An SPI value less than 1.0 indicates less work was completed than was planned. An SPI greater than 1.0 indicates that more work was completed than was planned. The SPI is equal to the ratio of the EV to the PV. Equation: SPI = EV/PV. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Yes, his decision is correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should compress the schedule.

No, his decision is not correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should use fast tracking not crashing.

No, his decision is not correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Performance Index SPI, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is ahead of schedule. No need to take corrective action.
Yes, his decision is correct. The ratio between EV and PV is called Schedule Variance SV, and if it is more than one, it means that the project is behind schedule. He should compress the schedule.

text: During measuring project performance for a product development project against project baselines, you found that the schedule performance index (SPI) of 0.93 and the cost performance index (CPI) of 0.82. Generally, What is the reason behind this?
explanation: The project is behind schedule and over budget. Changes in scope may not result in increasing time and cost. When a supplier go out of business this doesn’t necessarily mean that affected activities are on the critical path. When additional equipments are needed this will increase cost and might not increase time. So the correct choice is that equipment is needed for a critical path activity that was delayed and the team purchased a more expensive one instead. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: A supplier went out of business and a new one needed to be found.
An equipment needed for a critical path activity was delayed and project team purchased a more expensive one instead.
Additional equipment needed to be purchased.
The scope was changed.

text: You are a project manager for a construction project that will install glass walls for a new company. The contract between your company and the customer is a time and material contract which stated that your company will get $11 per meter, and your company is doing all the work. The new company has 4 equal sides of 125 meter, and requires the installation of a six-meter diameter banner on one side. Glass walls should be installed at a rate of 100 meter per day. The banner installation will cost $500 and take one day to complete. The banner must be installed before work can begin on that side of the wall. After three days of work, one side is completed, another has 75 meter installed, and the banner is completely installed. So far, $2,700 of the total project budget has been used. What is the current status of the project?
explanation: EV=(125ft+75ft)11+500 = 2700, AC=2700 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: It is over budget with a cost variance of +$125.
The budget is neutral with cost variance of $0.
It is under budget, with a cost variance of +$500 due to the completion of the banner installation.
It is over budget, with a cost variance of -$1,100

text: You are the project manager for a large manufacturing project. During estimating activity costs for your project using three-point estimates, a team member asks you that he needs to add 5% to each activity cost to account for unidentified risks. What should you tell him?
explanation: During estimating activity costs, the project team should estimate the activity costs and the contingency reserve, while management reserves are estimated by management as part of the Determine Budget process. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245 and 252

choices.text: He is right, management reserve must be added to account for unidentified risks.
You should instruct him not increase the estimate.
He is right, contingency reserve must be added to account for known-unknowns.
Tell him that you must get sponsor approval before increasing the estimates.

text: You are managing a software project. The project budget seems to be inaccurate. The SPI is 1.15. Two project team members resigned last week and The team has had negative deviation from the activity attributes. What is the best thing for the project manager to do?
explanation: Re-estimating activity attributes is not necessary. The first thing is to calculate SPI and CPI for the project to gain full understanding of the project status. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Re-compute the project schedule and budget.
Re-estimate the activity attributes.
Calculate the cost performance index.
Try to deal with the high turn-over rate in your project.

text: The project manager is analyzing project performance using earned value management tool. He determines that the cost variance is – 10,000 $. What is the best thing to do?
explanation: Schedule variance should be determined firstly to complete the data needed to analyze project status and then take the required corrective action. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Determine the schedule variance.
Make activities in parallel that are planned in series.
Ask for guidance from PMO.
Move resources from the project to one that is not failing.

The project sponsor is worried about the status of the project, he asks Samuel to provide a quick report about the status of the project. Which of the following statements would he mention in his report?
explanation: EV=500,000 and CV=-100,000, AC=600,000. CPI = EV/AC Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 262-263 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The SPI is 1.2
The CPI is 0.83
The CPI is 1.2
The SPI is 0.83

text: Management reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address:
explanation: Management reserves are an amount of the project budget withheld for management control purposes and are reserved for unforeseen work that is within scope of the project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 252 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 62

Anticipated and uncertain events

text: Sam has just been promoted to a project manager position and he is managing his first major network rollout project. His sponsor is worried about the status of the project . In order to reduce the boss's stress he calculated the earned value management calculations and offered to the sponsor. The project has a total budget of $80,000 and CPI of 0.95. The project has spent $25,000 of its budget so far. The sponsor needs to know how much more money does Sam plan to spend on the project?
explanation: EAC = BAC / CPI=84,210, ETC = EAC -AC=59210 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: Samuel is managing a product development project that is bugeted at 1,550,000$. The project is supposed to be completed by today, but it is now 76% complete only. The incurred cost to reach this point is 1,315,000$. What is the cost performance index (CPI) at this point?
explanation: AC=1,315,000$, as the project should be finished at this point, so PV = 1,550,000$, EV =0.761,550,000 = 1,178,000. CPI = EV/AC = 1,178,000/1,315,000 = 0.9. SPI = EV/PV = 1,178,000/1,550,000 = 0.76. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100*

text: While monitoring the cost performance in a small project which was budgeted for $85,000 over a 9 weeks period. As of today, you’ve spent $42,000 of your budget to complete work that you originally expected would cost $44,000. According to your schedule, you should have spent $50,000 by this point. Based on this situation, what is the status of the project?
explanation: AC = 42000, EV= 44000, PV = 50000 SPI = EV/PV = 44000/50000 <1 behind schedule CPI = EV/AC = 44000/42000 >1 under budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Under budget and ahead of schedule.
Over budget and ahead of schedule.
Under budget and behind schedule.
Over budget and behind schedule.

text: Julian is managing a large construction project with a total budget of $450,000. According to the schedule, his team should have completed 45% of the work by now. But at the latest status report, the team only reported that 40% of the work has actually been completed. The team has spent $165,000 till now on the project. How would he best describe the status of the project?
explanation: EV=180000, PV=202500, AC=165000 EV < PV, EV > AC Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: You have just been authorized as a project manager for a small project, identified project stakeholders and are moving into project planning. A project stakeholder asks you for the project’s budget and cost baseline. What should you tell him?
explanation: The project budget can be found in the project charter but it is not a detailed one. It is possible to complete the estimate before creating the project management plan because the ROM (Rough Order of Magnitude) estimate is created during the Initiation process. Even small projects must have a budget, so the best choice is that the project budget and baseline will not be finalized and accepted until the planning processes are completed. Domain: Process. Refer to PMBOK 6th edition, page 254 and PMBOK 7th edition, page 62.

choices.text: The project budget and baseline will not be finalized and accepted until the planning processes are completed.
It is impossible to complete an estimate before the project management plan is created.
The project budget can be found in the project charter, which has just been completed.
The project management plan will not contain the project’s budget and baseline; it is a small project.

text: Your sponsor wants to know the Estimate at Completion for your project. The project was budgeted at $30,000, and to date you have spent $20,000 but only completed $10,000 worth of work. You are sure that the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate.
explanation: As the work will be accomplished at the planned rate EAC=AC+BAC-EV= 20000 + 30000 - 10000 = 40000. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are a project manager for a large tele-communication project that was initially budgeted at $9,600,000. While preparing for your weekly status report you find that you have spent till now $4,000,000, the cost variance for your project is $-500,000, the schedule performance index is 1.12. In light of this, what is the earned value of the project?
explanation: CV=EV-AC, EV=AC+CV Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: Robert is managing a large manufacturing project. Dave is the project sponsor and at the same time he is the direct manager of Robert. Dave wants to know about the earned value calculations. Robert provided him with this data the project total budget is 120,000$, the total amount spent till now is 70,000$ and the team has actually completed 50% worth of work. If the future project work will be accomplished at the planned rate, what should the Estimate at Completion (EAC) be?
explanation: As the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate, so EAC = AC + BAC - EV. EV = 0.5 * 120,000, EV = 60,000$. BAC = 120,000$ and AC = 70,000$. EAC = 70,000+120,000-60,000 = 130,000$. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are managing a mechanical project. The sponsor is worried about the status of the project. You provided him with the earned value calculations AC = $24,100, ETC = $44,600, VAC = -$1,600, BAC =$89,000, and EAC = $91,100. Your sponsor asks you to forecast how much money you expect to spend on the remainder of the project. Which is the best estimate to use for this forecast?
explanation: No need for calculations it asks about ETC. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: You are managing a project with a schedule performance index (SPI) of 1.03 and a cost performance index (CPI) of 0.96. How would you best describe this project?
explanation: SPI>1 means ahead of schedule, CPI<1 over budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: Andrew is an accountant who has recently joined XYZ organization which has a long agile approach. Andrew has a good experience in traditional projects, but he has never worked on agile projects before. He asks an agile coach how costs and returns are monitored and tracked on agile projects. Which of the following is a correct answer to Andrew's question?
explanation: Agile approach follows the principle of incremental delivery which means that each release will deliver value. So, ROI can be generated early as soon as value is delivered. Domain = Process. Agile Practice Guide, Page 16

choices.text: It is the same as traditional projects as both use S-curve.
It is the same as traditional projects as both use earned value management.
Cost is not a concern as it is fixed. In agile projects scope is variable.
ROI can be generated while executing the project.

text: You are managing a project which was budgeted at 1,250,000$ and scheduled to be completed within six months. During project executing, the sponsor asked you about the status of the project. You collected the needed data to calculate earned value measurements. You found that the project is 35% complete although it should be 40% complete. You have already spent 550,000 $ to reach this point in the project. What would you tell the sponsor?
explanation: EV is the value of work accomplished. EV = 0.35 * 1,250,000 = 437,500. PV is the value of the planned work = 0.4 * 1,250,000 = 500,000. and AC is the actual incurred cost AC= 550,000. SPI = EV/PV= 0.875. CPI = EV/AC = 0.8. So the project is behind schedule and over budget Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and over budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and under budget.
The project is behind schedule and over budget.
The project is behind schedule and under budget.

text: You are working for a major pipeline project. The project is very important and highly visible for your organization. It is performed using 32 human resources. As you review the project results, you notice that the value of the work accomplished is $1,200,000 at the last reporting point. You know the schedule performance is good, since your SPI is 1.2 while you have spent $1,050,000 to this point, what are the CPI, and the schedule and cost variances?
explanation: EV = 1200000, SPI = 1.2, AC = 1050000, SPI = EV/PV, PV = EV/SPI = 1200000/1.2, PV = 1000000 CPI = EV/AC = 1200000/1050000 = 1.14 SV = EV-PV = 1200000 – 1000000 = 200000 CV = EV-AC = 1200000 – 1050000 = 150000 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: The cost baseline is the approved version of the time-phased project budget, excluding any management reserves. It is used as a basis for comparison to actual results. It is displayed in the form of:
explanation: The cost baseline is displayed in the form of S-Curve. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 254 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 189

Inverted S-Curve
Bubble Chart
Hierarchical Chart

text: You are a project manager for a tele-communication project, the project is to swap the old network for 2 cities with a new network. You have been asked by top management to cut the project costs by 10% after you submitted them. The top management expect 25% improvement in drop calls as a result of the project. There are 35 stakeholders in the project and the scope of the project is unclear. What is your best course of action?
explanation: If your estimates are accurate then you are ethically and professionally responsible for supporting them. If there is a need to cut project costs then the top management should help the project manager in finding another solution and to evaluate its impacts on project scope, schedule,..etc Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 241 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 55

choices.text: Re-plan to achieve a 35% improvement in drop calls.
Provide an accurate estimate of the actual costs and be able to support your estimates.
Reduce the estimate by 10% as required and note the change in the risk management plan.
Meet with the team to identify where you can find 10% savings.

text: George is the project manager for a construction project. He is currently reviewing the latest work performance report from his team. The report contains the earned value measurements to this point, forecasts and variances. Which of the following values contribute to the greatest risk in the project?
explanation: TCPI is the ratio between work remaining and budget remaining, if it is greater than one, this means that work remaining is greater than budget remaining, which means high risk. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 105

choices.text: TCPI = 1.05
Schedule Variance SV = 1,500$

text: What is the status of the project when the earned value of the project is higher than both the actual costs and planned value?
explanation: When the EV is greater than both PV and AC then this means that the value of all the work completed EV to this point in time is greater than the value of the work planned to be completed PV and the actual costs spent AC. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is performing good as it is running faster than planned and under the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running slower than planned and under the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running slower than planned and over the planned cost.
The project is not performing good as it is running faster than planned and over the planned cost.

text: Contingency reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address:
explanation: Contingency reserves are often viewed as the part of the budget intended to address the known unknowns that can affect a project. The certain events are facts not risks. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 62

choices.text: Anticipated and certain events
Anticipated and uncertain events
Unanticipated events
Scope Creep

text: Project team members are estimating the costs of the activities that will be performed during the project. They are using three point estimating. The expected cost of the activity based on weighted average distribution equals 500$. The cost of the activity, based on realistic effort assessment for the required work and any predicted expenses equals 480$. The cost based on analysis of the best-case scenario for the activity equals 420$. What is The cost based on analysis of the worst-case scenario for the activity?
explanation: Beta distribution. cE = (cO + 4cM + cP) / 6. cM = 480, cO = 420 , cE = 500. cP = 6cE - cO - 4cM = 6*500 - 420 - 4*480 = 660$ Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245*

text: Jerry is managing a software project. He calls for a meeting with the project team to discuss the current variances. He receives a weekly report from the project team which includes earned value measurements for the project at this point. Which of the following variances contributes to the least risk in the project?
explanation: BAC is how much did we BUDGET for the TOTAL project effort. EAC is what do we currently expect the TOTAL project to cost. If BAC is greater than EAC this means that the planned budget is greater than the estimated budget, so there is enough funds for the project, which means risk is less. Domain = Process. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

choices.text: EAC is greater than BAC
BAC is greater than EAC
TCPI = 1.08
ETC is greater than BAC

text: You are managing a construction project in your organization budgeted at 4,000,000$ and scheduled to be completed in 10 months. During project executing, the customer complains that the project is running behind schedule. The sponsor is holding a meeting with you and the customer. The sponsor asked you about the reason of this delay, you answered him that you send a weekly report which contains the earned value measurements of the project. The last report shows that SPI = 1.05 which means that the project is running ahead of schedule not behind schedule. The customer insists that a critical deliverable due date is missed. What is the main problem in this situation?
explanation: The true answer is that you performed some activities not on the critical path earlier than planned, and some on the critical path later than planned. The values of the activities not on the critical path are higher than those on the critical path, which makes EV>PV and so SPI>1 Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: Your team is not following the communication management plan.
The customer is not following the communication management plan.
You performed some activities not on the critical path earlier than planned and some activities on the critical path later than planned.
You performed some activities on the critical path earlier than planned and some activities not on the critical path later than planned.

text: A cost performance index (CPI) of 0.98 means:
explanation: A cost performance index means how much dollars you get from each dollar invested. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: At this time, we expect the total project to cost 98 percent of the planned cost.
The project is progressing at 98 percent of the rate planned.
When the project is completed, we will have spent 98 percent of the planned cost.
The project is getting 98 cents out of every dollar invested.

text: You are a project manager for a construction project. You are in planning process group and estimating with team members the costs needed to perform the project. The cost of the material pessimistically $120,000, most likely $110,000, and optimistically $100,000. The cost of labor is pessimistically $100,000, most likely $90,000, and optimistically $85,000. The cost of equipment is pessimistically $60,000, optimistically $40,000 and most likely $50,000. The cost for management fees is pessimistically $50,000, most likely $40,000, and optimistically $30,000. What is the probability of the project coming in under $280,000?
explanation: Average Expected Cost = (P+4M+O)/6. Average cost of material = 110,000, labor = 90,833, Equipments = 50,000, Management fees = 40,000. Average Total Cost = 110000+ 90833+50000+40000 = 290833. Average Total Cost = 110000+ 90833+50000+40000 = 290,833. Mean is at 290833 which means that the probability of total cost to be > 290833 = 50% and the probability of total cost to be < 290833 = 50%. So the probability of total cost to be < 280000$ is less than 50%. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 245

choices.text: Exact 50 %.
Less than 50%.
Over 50%.
There is not enough information.

text: You are a project manager for a major construction project. The customer is very angry because there is a deliverable due date within two weeks and he believes that your team will not complete the deliverable before the due date. You meet with the customer to reduce his stress and you show him the earned value calculations. They show your cost performance index (CPI) is 1.25, your actual cost (AC) is $400 million, and your planned value (PV) is $490 million. Should your customer be comfortable?
explanation: Since CPI = EV/ AC, then EV= 1.25 400 M= 500 M, so SV= EV-PV = 500-490= 10M, SPI= EV/PV =500/490= 1.02, therefore the project is ahead of schedule, but this doesn’t mean that the activities needed to deliver project deliverables are on schedule, these deliverables might not be on the critical path. So he needs to prove to him that the activities leading to this deliverable are on schedule. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100*

choices.text: Yes, your SPI is 1.05.
Yes, your SV is $10 million.
No, your CPI is too high.
He needs more data.

text: You are managing an industrial project. You performed till now work valued at $15,000, which was planned to cost $12,000. You actually paid $11,000. What is the status of this project?
explanation: SPI = EV / PV = $15,000 / $12,000 = 1.25—so your project is ahead of schedule. CPI = EV / AC = $15,000 / $11,000 = 1.36—so your project is within its budget. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project is ahead of schedule and within its budget.
The project is behind schedule and within its budget.
The project is ahead of schedule and over its budget.
The project is behind schedule and over its budget.

text: Eric is a project manager of a construction project to install new glass windows in an office building. He planned to spend $21,300 on the project, but his costs are going higher than planned, and now he is afraid that his project is spending too much money. Which of the following parameters can he use to determine whether his project is over or under budget?
explanation: Cost variance (CV) is the amount of budget deficit or surplus at a given point in time, expressed as the difference between earned value and the actual cost. It is a measure of cost performance on a project. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 262 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: AC
EV
CV
VAC

S-Curve
Project Status Report

text: What is meant by cost risk?
explanation: The first thing to think of is: cost risks are risks or costs? Of course they are risks, so all answers saying it is cost should be eliminated. It is true that some risks cost the project money but this is not the right definition of cost risks. The right definition is that there is a risk that project costs could go higher than planned. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition

choices.text: The cost of all the identified risks if they happen.
There is a risk that project costs could go higher than planned.
There are risks that will cost the project money.

The planned budget for completing the project to date is 10000000$, the project mangers' calculations shows that the actual work done by the project is 1.2 the planned cost, while the work done is 0.89 the planned work to be done to date, in light of these info the project is considered:
explanation: The CPI = 1.2 and SPI= 0.89 which means the project is under budget but behind schedule. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

text: Robert is managing a large manufacturing project. Dave is the project sponsor and at the same time he is the direct manager of Robert. Dave wants to know about the earned value calculations. Robert provided him with this data the project total budget is 120,000$, the total amount spent till now is 70,000$ and the team has actually completed 50% worth of work. If the CPI is expected to be the same for the remainder of the project, what should the Estimate at Completion (EAC) be?
explanation: If the CPI is expected to be the same for the remainder of the project, so EAC = BAC/CPI. EV = 0.5 * 120,000, EV = 60,000$. BAC = 120,000$ and AC = 70,000$. CPI = EV/AC = 60,000/70,000 = 0.857. EAC = 120,000/0.857 = 140,000$ Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 265 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 104

text: After analyzing the status of your project, you determine the earned value (EV) = 500,000 $ and the planned value (PV) = 550,000 $. What should you expect at the end of the project as a result if this trend continues?
explanation: Since EV is less than PV, therefore the amount of work performed is less than what was planned, so the project is behind schedule and will finish later than the planned date. Domain = Process. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 261 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 100

choices.text: The project will finish below the original cost estimate.
The actual cost will be lower than planned.
The estimate at completion will be lower than planned.
The project will finish behind schedule.

text: A project team has been formed to work on a software project which has just been initiated. It is the first time for this team to work together. Which of the following is the best way to lead this team in this stage of the project?
explanation: Early in a team's formation, the role of the team leader is to directly help with project activities and present a clear, tactical picture of what needs to be done. So the directing leadership style is more directive than supportive. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Everybody in the company does what Paul says, because they all know that he is a close friend to the CEO of the company. What kind of power does he hold over the team?
explanation: Everybody in the company does what Paul says not because his power or his authority but because of his relationship with the CEO. The power used here is referent power. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Reward
Punishment
Referent

text: An agile team has committed to deliver 50 story points during the running iteration. Midway through the iteration one team member becomes sick and must have rest for the remaining time of the iteration. A team member suggests that the team can work overtime to complete the committed story points in the iteration. The team leader should inform him that his suggestion contradicts with which agile principle?
explanation: Agile methods recognize the value of a sustainable pace that allows team members to maintain a work-life balance. A sustainable pace is not only better for the team; it benefits the organization as well. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 8

choices.text: At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly.
The best architectures, requirements, and designs emerge from self-organizing teams.
Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.
Simplicity—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.

text: In high-performing projects, who should exhibit effective leadership skills?
explanation: Leadership is not exclusive to any specific role. High-performing projects may feature multiple people exhibiting effective leadership skills, for example, the project manager, sponsors, stakeholders, senior management, or even project team members. Anyone working on a project can demonstrate effective leadership traits, styles, and skills to help the project team perform and deliver.

choices.text: Project Manager
Project Sponsor
Senior Management
Anyone

text: Peter is currently managing a large software project. His project is currently facing chaos. He decides to use directive leadership. What would be the reason behind using this leadership style?
explanation: In moments of chaos, directive action creates more clarity and momentum than collaborative problem solving. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Because in moments of chaos, directive action creates more participation than any other leadership style.
Because this leadership style elicits more productivity than any other leadership style.
Because this might be the only leadership style he has experience with.
Because in moments of chaos, directive action creates more clarity and momentum than collaborative problem solving.

text: XYZ organization executives have assigned Harry to form a project team to deliver a software to a client. Harry has formed the project team and motivated them towards achieving the project goal and influenced them to align their individual interests in favor of collective effort, and achieve success as a project team rather than as individuals. The organization used ______ while Harry used ______.
explanation: The organization exercised authority by assigning Harry to form the team, while Harry demonstrated leadership by motivating and influencing the team to align their interests toward collective success. Domain = People.

choices.text: Stewardship, responsibility
Responsibility, stewardship
Authority, leadership
Leadership, authority

text: Rebecca is a scrum master working on a large software project. The product owner assigned to the project is always very busy, as he has some other work assigned to him within the organization. As a result, the product owner spends very little time with the team which causes a lot of troubles. What should Rebecca do?
explanation: The product owner needs to participate in scrum events as he is a customer representative. He must be involved to ensure the project success. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Coach the product owner on the importance of participating in scrum events.
Request another product owner and distribute the work between them.
Escalate the product owner to the project sponsor.
Take the product owner responsibilities during his absence.

text: Helena is a team member who has recently joined a running construction project. She noticed that there is a difference between leadership styles of Kevin, the project manager of the current project and Andrea the project manager of her previous project. Kevin always focuses on goals and achievements, while Andrea focuses on team members learning, development and relationships. What leadership styles do they adopt?
explanation: Transactional style focuses on goals, feedback, and accomplishment, while servant leader style focuses on other people’s growth, learning, development, autonomy, and well-being; concentrates on relationships, community and collaboration. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 65 and The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Kevin adopts transactional style, while Andrea adopts charismatic style.
Kevin adopts transformational style, while Andrea adopts servant leader style.
Kevin adopts transactional style, while Andrea adopts servant leader style.
Kevin adopts laissez-faire style, while Andrea adopts interactive style.

text: A project team has been formed to work on a product development project. It is the first time for this team to work together. After few weeks, while the team members figure out how to work together, some conflict and struggle happened between the team members. Which of the following is the best leadership style to lead a team in this stage of the project?
explanation: As the team passes into the storming phase, there will generally be plenty of disagreement, open conflict, and harsh dialogue. During this stage, the leader needs to assume the coaching style to help team members resolve conflicts without damaging relationships. So the coaching leadership style should provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition.

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Phil has been assigned to manage a new network installation project. The project team is formed from highly competent and engaged staff within the organization. Which of the following is the best leadership style to use in this situation?
explanation: For environments with highly competent and engaged staff, empowered delegation elicits more productivity than centralized coordination. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Laissez-faire
Directive
Empowered delegation
Autocratic

text: A project manager wants to follow Herzberg's theory of motivation, all of the following are motivating agents that she should follow except:
explanation: Salary is a hygiene factor. Poor hygiene factors may destroy motivation, however improving hygiene factors may not improve motivation. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Recognition
Responsibility
Self-actualization
Salary

text: Fatima is a scrum master for a software project. During the first sprint, she notices that some developers are not engaged during the daily scrum. The developers usually don't participate and sometimes they check their cell phones during the daily scrum. How can she address this issue?
explanation: The role of the scrum master is to help everyone understand scrum theory and practice. She should coach the team about the importance of the daily scrum and the importance of their participation. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Instruct the team about the importance of the daily scrum.
Decrease the frequency of the daily scrum to be twice per week instead of once per day.
Bring this issue as an impediment during the next daily scrum.
Discuss the issue in the next retrospective.

text: Mark is a project manager on a software project. He is always watching his team members during their work, during their breaks, and when they leave. He always walks around the office to make sure that everyone is doing his work. He always makes all the project decisions. What kind of manager is he?
explanation: According to Mc Gregor theory, X manager is always watching his team members, doesn't trust them and believes that they may avoid work whenever possible. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Theory X
Theory Y
Motivating
Effective

text: What should the scrum master do in the daily standups?
explanation: In a daily standup, the scrum master's role is to listen and record any obstacles to the team's progress for immediate follow up. The team is self organized and the discussion is run by the team for the team, so there is no need for facilitator or someone to resolve their conflicts. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 53 and 54

choices.text: Facilitate and control the meeting.
Ask the team about the root cause of their problems.
Resolve team conflict.
Listen and note any problems for follow-up.

text: The project manager says to the team member: "You need to listen to me because I have been put in charge. Perform the work assigned to you". Which power is the project manager using?
explanation: The project manager here is using the power derived from his position (formal or legitimate). Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Situational
Charismatic
Punitive

text: Midway through the project and after many clashes between the team members, it has been noticed that the team members started to adjust their work habits and behaviors and a sense of cohesion and unity has started to emerge between team members. At this stage, what is the most appropriate leadership style?
explanation: When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. This doesn’t mean the team leader can simply go into cruise control mode, however. Instead, the leader needs to play a supporting role. The team will still need help with conflict resolution, as well as reminders to enforce the norms they have created.

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: You are leading a project team for the fourth project they work on together. As the team members have worked together before on many projects, consensus and cooperation have been well-established and the team is mature, organized, and well-functioning. What is the most appropriate leadership style you can use?
explanation: Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing. They require little more than to be pointed in the right direction and given regular recognition and appreciation for their high performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Directing
Supporting
Coaching
Delegating

text: Adam has been assigned as a project manager for a software project as a replacement for another project manager. The project team consists of 12 members with different skills and experience and each has an action plan for personal development. He wants to adapt his leadership style to support team members according to their action plans for personal development. Which of the following models can help him in this situation?
explanation: The OSCAR coaching and mentoring model helps individuals adapt their coaching or leadership styles to support individuals who have an action plan for personal development. The model refers to five contributing factors outcome, situation, choices/consequences, actions and review. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 156

choices.text: ADKAR
OSCAR
Virginia Satir
Cynefin Framework

text: In the middle of a sprint, a team member is out on a sick leave. The sprint is very critical and any delay in the product increment delivery would endanger the sprint goal. The scrum team are working on their full capacity. In light of this, what should the scrum master do?
explanation: It is true that the sprint can not be extended, but doing nothing is not an appropriate solution. Working overtime is against agile manifesto eighth principle which states that the team should maintain sustainable pace. The best solution is to share the team challenge with the stakeholders and the project sponsor. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: Ask the scrum team to work overtime till the team member is back from his sick leave.
Discuss this topic with the sponsor and stakeholders in order to share the team challenge.
Ask the team to redistribute the tasks between them and focus only on the most important features.
Do nothing, the sprint can not be extended.

text: The project manager for the new project notices that the meeting room seats and air conditioner are not good. She turns her attention to influencing the organization to improve the team’s working conditions. Which motivational theory is she following?
explanation: Herzber theory deals with motivating agents and hygiene factors like working conditions, salary and work relationships. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Maslow’s hierarchy
Expectancy theory
Herzberg
McGregor

text: An organization adopts agile transformation. Some project managers roles will be switched to team facilitators according to the new structure. They will need to enhance servant leadership skills. Which of the following is an example of servant leadership?
explanation: Servant leadership focuses on removing impediments and supporting the team to perform at its best. Doing administrative work for the team is an example of servant leadership. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: Creating the project plan on weekend so as not to disturb the team.
Doing the administrative work for the team.
Posting the project Gantt chart on the office wall.
Handing out detailed task lists to the team.

text: What is the personality trait of a person who has the ability to perceive the information presented by others and to manage them?
explanation: Emotional character has the ability to perceive emotions and the information they present and to manage them; measure of interpersonal skills. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Managerial
Political
Emotional
Social

text: You are a project manager for a new project in a weak matrix organization. The project team formally don’t report to you and you don’t have authority to reward them for their performance. The project is very difficult and has aggressive schedule and tight date constraints. The project requires a high quality standard. Based on these circumstances, what is the most effective power for the project manager will be likely to use?
explanation: The project manager works in a weak matrix organization, so all the powers derived from his position will not be effective like reward, penalty or formal powers. The only power he can use here is the expert power. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Reward
Penalty
Formal
Expert

text: A three phases project adopts a hybrid development approach. The first phase is hardware development adopts a traditional approach. The second phase is software development adopts an adaptive approach. The third phase is systems integration adopts an adaptive approach. The first phase has come to an end. The project manager and the project team are ready to start the second phase. Accordingly some roles and responsibilities will change. Which of the following responsibilities will be changed for the project manager?
explanation: The project manager's role with a predictive phase is more directive and controlling, whereas agile leadership requires servant leadership. Agile teams are considered self-organizing. The team will plan and control the project work. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Detailed work planning, product delivery and team management will be delegated to the project team.
Planning the project work through Kanban board instead of Gantt chart.
Act as a servant leader helping the team sizing the user stories and calculating the team's velocity.
Act as a team facilitator by helping the team to assign user stories according to the team members' skills.

text: A project team is working on a mechanical project. It is the fifth project that this team is working on. The team members have developed a synergy due to working together on many projects, the best leadership style to lead this team is to:
explanation: Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing. They require little more than to be pointed in the right direction and given regular recognition and appreciation for their high performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 30

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: Which of the following is among the scrum master's roles during the daily scrum?
explanation: The daily scrum is conducted by the team for the team. The scrum master is a coach, he teaches the developers to keep the daily scrum within the 15 minutes timebox. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 41

choices.text: Teach the developers to keep the daily scrum within the 15 minutes timebox.
Facilitate the discussion to ensure that each team member has a chance to speak.
Ensure that each developer has answered the three questions.
Lead the discussion and intervene when needed.

text: Which of the following statements represents guilt-based power?
explanation: Imposition of obligation or sense of duty are examples of using guilt-based. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: You must do what I say because I'm the project manager and I'm accountable on project success.
If you don't achieve your target, you will not get the annual bonus.
You must comply with HR rules and come to work on time.
If you face this type of problems in your work, solve it like this, I have been solving this type of problems the same way over the last three years and never failed.

text: A project is being implemented using adaptive approach. Midway through the project, a quality issue has been discovered that prevents releasing a key deliverable to the customer. The product owner wants to analyze the root cause of the issue. In light of this, what should the team facilitator do?
explanation: The team facilitator is a servant leader. He needs to guide the team members and help them implement the agreed solution. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Coach the team members on how to reach consensus on proposed solutions.
Let the team members decide what to do as they are self organized.
Facilitate a meeting with relevant stakeholders to collect more ideas.
Discuss analyzing the root cause with the team and implement the agreed solution.

text: What is meant by self-organizing teams?
explanation: The self-organizing team, where the team functions with an absence of centralized control. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 310 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 249

choices.text: The team consists of subject matter experts.
The team functions without a team leader.
The team functions without conflicts between team members.
The team functions with an absence of centralized control.

text: Midway during an iteration, one of the project team members informs the project leader that his computer is not connected to the company intranet. What should the project leader do?
explanation: The project leader is a team facilitator and a servant leader. Servant leaders work to fulfill the needs of the teams, projects, and organization. Servant leader focuses on paving the way for the team to do its best work. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 36

choices.text: The team is cross functional, ask another team member who may have IT experience to step in and fix the issue.
Facilitate a resolution with IT department.
The team is self organized, the team member should try to resolve the issue by himself or contact IT department.
Update the issue log and develop a resolution plan.

text: Victor is a project manager working on a project to create a mobile application for a customer. The project team consists of 10 experienced developers who thrive on autonomy. The team has low morale and feel demotivated. What can Victor do to tackle this issue?
explanation: Project team members who thrive on autonomy will perform better if they can establish their own ways of working and even their own work hours and cadence. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 25

choices.text: Request a salary increase for the team.
Stretch the team goals.
Form dynamic working group for demotivated team members.
Let the team establish their own ways of working.

text: Those who act responsibly to carry out activities with integrity, care, and trustworthiness while maintaining compliance with internal and external guidelines are known as:
explanation: Stewards act responsibly to carry out activities with integrity, care, and trustworthiness while maintaining compliance with internal and external guidelines. They demonstrate a broad commitment to financial, social, and environmental impacts of the projects they support. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 24

choices.text: Stewards
Servant Leaders
Project Managers
Scrum Masters

text: The daily standup usually takes more than 15 minutes because the product owner takes some time distributing tasks to the team members. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: The team is self-managed and self-organized. So, tasks are self-assigned by the team. The daily standup is for the team and by the team. There is no need for the product owner to attend the daily standup. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 53

choices.text: The scrum master should distribute tasks to team member after the daily standup.
Extend the daily standup to 30 minutes.
The scrum master should distribute tasks to team member before the daily standup.
The scrum master should ask the product owner not to attend the daily standup and not to distribute tasks to team members.

text: XYZ organization has initiated a new software project. The new project will adopt an adaptive development approach. Resources are being carefully selected for this project because this project is for a new customer and expected to be in a long-term partnership with this customer. Which of the following types of resources will be suitable for this project?
explanation: Successful agile teams are made up of generalizing specialists, or “T-shaped” people. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide Page 42

choices.text: People with deep specialization in one area.
Distributed work teams.
I-shaped
T-shaped

text: Bruce is a project manager for an industrial project. This is the first project he manages. He expects to face some difficulties with team members and stakeholders because he usually accepts others for what and who they are and always shows open concern. He is worried that his personality characteristics may affect managing the team members and achieving project objectives. What is his personality trait?
explanation: Authentic personality accepts others for what and who they are, show open concern. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 66

choices.text: Authentic
Courteous
Emotional
Social

text: Which of the following is the correct pairing of leadership styles and team phases in Tuckman model of team formation and development progress?
explanation: When the team is in the forming stage, the role of the team leader is to directly help with project activities and present a clear, tactical picture of what needs to be done. So the directing leadership style is more directive than supportive. As the team passes into the storming phase, there will generally be plenty of disagreement, open conflict, and harsh dialogue. During this stage, the leader needs to assume the coaching style to help team members resolve conflicts without damaging relationships. When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. Performing teams are autonomous, empowered, self-managing, and self-policing.

choices.text: Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Supporting and Norming, Delegating and Performing
Directing and Forming, Supporting and Storming, Coaching and Norming, Delegating and Performing
Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Delegating and Norming, Supporting and Performing
Supporting and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Directing and Norming, Delegating and Performing

text: Michael is managing an accounting software project. He finds that bringing all of his team members together into a single room to work increases their communication, and decreases misunderstandings. This is referred to as a:
explanation: Colocation involves placing many or all of the most active project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 340

choices.text: Colocation
Virtual team
Team building activities
Conflict resolution techniques

text: After the newly formed project team has gone through many conflicts between the team members, the project team starts to function as a collective body. Team members know their places on the team and how they relate to and interface with all the other members. They are starting to work together. What is the best leadership style to lead a team at this stage?
explanation: When the team reaches the norming phase, the members have successfully created rules (team norms) to help govern themselves. This doesn’t mean the team leader can simply go into cruise control mode, however. Instead, the leader needs to play a supporting role. The team will still need help with conflict resolution, as well as reminders to enforce the norms they have created. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 166

choices.text: Provide a more directive than supportive leadership.
Provide a more supportive than directive leadership.
Provide high levels of both directive and supportive leadership.
Provide low levels of both directive and supportive leadership.

text: A product development project has been initiated in XYZ organization, where organization's senior management, project sponsor and project manager attempt to exert project influence in multiple, misaligned directions. Which of the following is most likely to happen?
explanation: More conflict and confusion can emerge when too many participants attempt to exert project influence in multiple, misaligned directions. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: More motivation for project team and stakeholders.
More conflict and confusion can emerge.
More alignment toward project goal.
More commitment to senior management, sponsor and project manager directions.

text: During daily standup, a project team member A has mentioned an impediment that the product owner and a lead developer will leave the organization this month. Team member B has mentioned an impediment of delay in required components which will affect product increment delivery. Team member C has mentioned an impediment that the logistics provider contract will expire this week. Team member D has mentioned an impediment that the number of defects found till now is higher than expected. Which impediment should the scrum master focus on first?
explanation: Finding a product owner is the most important impediment for the scrum master to work on. The product owner is responsible for prioritizing the product backlog items and helps the teams see how to deliver the highest value without creating waste. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Finding a product owner.
Asking procurement department to renew the contract with the logistics supplier.
Finding the root cause of the defects.
Finding a replacement for the delayed component.

text: All of the following are not “hygiene factors” under Herzberg’s Motivation-Hygiene Theory except:
explanation: Motivational factors include matters that relate to the content of the work, such as achievement, growth, and advancement. Herzberg also identified hygiene factors related to the work, such as company policies, salary, and the physical environment. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: Recognition for excellent work
Self-actualization
Company policy
Achievements

text: Which of the following is an example of a reward system?
explanation: Reward must be achievable and motivating. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 341 and PMBOK 7th edition, Page 158

choices.text: The team member who works hardest will receive $1,000.
Everyone will get a bonus of $300 if the project finishes in on time.
All the team members will have a salary raise if the company achieved good revenue.
All the project team members will get 500$ if the product of the project was state-of-the-art.

text: Mike is a project manager for a software project. He is managing a project team which consists of twelve team members. He has noticed that two of his team members are demotivated, Dave who likes relatedness and Noel who likes new challenges. Which of the following is the best course of action?
explanation: A project team member who is motivated by challenge will respond well to stretch goals and problems to solve. A project team member who is motivated by relatedness will respond to being part of a dynamic working group. Tailoring motivation methods based on individual preferences helps to elicit the best individual and project team performance. Domain = People. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 25

choices.text: Mike should let both of them establish their own ways of working.
Mike should apply a motivation method for the team as a whole not per individual.
Mike should assign Dave to be a part of a dynamic group and stretch goals for Noel.
Mike should ask for a motivational bonus for both of them.

text: During iteration planning for an agile project, the team has committed to 50 story points for the coming iteration. However, the product owner wants the team to deliver five more story points which will deliver more value to the customer. The team is uncomfortable committing more as it hasn't understood the stories well. The agile coach is trying to solve the problem, what should she do?
explanation: Adding more details and acceptance criteria will help the team understand the stories better and make an informed decision about their commitment. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide

choices.text: She should inform the product owner that the five more story points will be added to the next iteration.
She should explain to the product owner that the team determines their commitment and he needs to accept what they have identified.
She should ask the product owner to review the stories and add more details and acceptance criteria to help the team better determine if they can deliver more stories.
She should ask the team to increase their velocity and if needed she can ask for more resources.

text: All the project team trust John and do what he says because he showed great performance during the financial crisis which his organization faced last year. Which power does John have on the project team?
explanation: Situational power is gained due to unique situation such as a specific crisis. Domain = People. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 63

choices.text: Legitimate
Situational
Charismatic
Ingratiating

text: Which of the following leadership styles has proven to be the universally best or recommended approach?
explanation: Documented leadership styles range from autocratic, democratic, laissez-faire, directive, participative, assertive, supportive, and autocratic to consensus. Of all these, no single leadership style has proven to be the universally best or recommended approach. Instead, effective leadership is shown when it best fits a given situation. Domain = People. The Standard for Project Management, Page 41

choices.text: Autocratic
Democratic
Laissez-faire
None of them

text: Midway during a sprint, a team member who is working on a critical item informs the team and the scrum master in a daily scrum that he will be on leave due to a family issue for three days. The backlog item which he is working on is very critical as there is a mandatory dependency for this item to be completed in order to start working on some other backlog items. In light of this, what should the scrum master do?
explanation: Reprioritizing the sprint backlog is not a solution as there is a mandatory dependency. The scrum master should ask the team member's functional manager to provide a replacement during his leave. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 39

choices.text: Ask the team member to complete the critical backlog items before going on leave.
Ask the team to reprioritize the sprint backlog.
Request from the team member's functional manager to provide a replacement for the team member during his leave.
Ask the product owner to reprioritize the sprint backlog.

text: The fifth principle of the Agile Manifesto states that: "Build projects around motivated individuals. Give them the environment and support they need, and trust them to get the job done". Which of the following agile practices and techniques is closely related to this principle?
explanation: Having the best people is significantly more important for a project than having the best processes. Agile methods promote empowered teams. People work better when they are given the autonomy to organize and plan their own work. Allowing the team to create their own team charter with team norms and values will help create an agile environment in which team members can perform at their best. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 41

choices.text: Burndown chart
Release planning
Backlog preparation
Team charter

text: An agile practitioner has been assigned to be a scrum master for a scrum team, what should he do next?
explanation: Each element of the scrum framework serves a specific purpose that is essential to the overall value and results realized with scrum. Changing the core design or ideas of scrum, leaving out elements, or not following the rules of scrum, covers up problems and limits the benefits of scrum, potentially even rendering it useless. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 39

choices.text: Check the latest retrospective findings.
Check the information radiators to know the status of the project.
Start to inspect the team processes to confirm they are aligned with scrum accepted practices.
Start identifying team issues and work with the team to solve them.

text: You are an agile practitioner to be assigned to a new project. There are two teams in the organization who can work on this project. Team A has John a business analyst, Mark a UI designer, Steve a coder and Smith a system tester. They are all experts in their fields. Team B has Mathew and Ann who can both work as business analyst and UI designer as well and Chris and Sandra who can both work as coder and system tester as well. Which team will you prefer to work with and why?
explanation: Generalizing specialists are individuals who have cross-functional skills and can readily move between roles. Domain = People. Agile Practice Guide, Page 42

choices.text: Team A because team members are generalizing specialists.
Team B because team members are generalizing specialists.
Team A because team members are traditional specialists.
Team B because team members are traditional specialists.

text: Philip is the managing director of a famous fast food restaurants chain. He is facing troubles with delaying customer orders. During the last three months, his company received more than 200 complains from customers due to delayed orders. In order to improve the customers' orders management, he decided to treat each order as a project. The project manager will be responsible for handling customers' orders, ensuring order delivery within pre- determined time, resolving customer issues. The project manager is not required to prepare a plan for each order rather than preparing a daily report for all orders. How would you describe this situation?
explanation: The mentioned work here is operational work not project work. An ongoing work effort is generally a repetitive process that follows an organization’s existing procedures. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 16

choices.text: This is a group of related projects, so these orders are considered as a program.
Each order is a project, so there should be a charter for each project.
This is a portfolio, because all these orders help to achieve the same strategic objective.
This is operational work.

text: A project team has created a software as a project deliverable for a customer. The customer has initiated the project and requested a software solution because they think that the solution resolves the business need for higher productivity. The software which is the output of the project does not enable the productivity outcome that is intended. The project stakeholders feel that the project has failed. Which of the following best represents the root cause of this issue?
explanation: The main issue here is the focus on deliverables not on the intended outcomes. To support value realization from projects, project teams shift focus from deliverables to the intended outcomes. Doing so allows project teams to deliver on the vision or purpose of the project, rather than simply creating a specific deliverable. Domain = Business Environment. The Standard for Project Management, Page 36

choices.text: The project team did not understand the intended outcome from the deliverable.
The project requirements were not collected in details at the beginning of the project.
The project team were not involved from the beginning of the project.
There was a communication gap between the customer and the project team.

text: Sergio is a newly assigned project manager in a construction firm. He has been assigned to establish a PMO in the organization, to provide the projects' team members with required templates, training, access to information and lessons learned. According the mentioned degree of control, the PMO is considered to be:
explanation: Supportive PMOs provide a consultative role to projects by supplying templates, best practices, training, access to information and lessons learned from other projects. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 48

choices.text: Adaptive
Supportive
Controlling
Directive

text: The organization has recently signed a contract with the government of two countries to build a very large bridge linking the two countries crossing a sea. The required work is very large and complex, it is budgeted at 2 billions $ and scheduled to be completed within 3 years. The required work can be best described as:
explanation: Programs are not large projects. A very large project may be referred to as a megaproject. As a guideline, megaprojects cost US$1billion or more, affect 1 million or more people, and run for years. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 10

choices.text: Operational work
Megaproject
Program
Portfolio

text: An organization wants to adopt agile transformation. The organization management board need to include more agile methodologies in the organization's projects. What should be done prior to including agile methodologies in the organization's projects?
explanation: The organization should first assess the organizational culture and readiness to undertake this initiative. This organization change usually takes time and is recommended to be gradually and incrementally not an abrupt change. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Assess the organization's culture and readiness for transformation.
Hire a group of agile coaches.
Provide training for the current employees on agile methodologies.
Pause all current projects because they adopt traditional approach.

text: Which of the following is the top priority for an agile project?
explanation: As per the agile manifesto "Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software". So the top priority is satisfying the customer through delivery of valuable product. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide Page 8

choices.text: Working collaboratively with customer and having a lightweight contract.
Satisfying the customer through delivery of valuable product.
Providing working software and accurate documentation.
Responding to change and following adaptive plan.

text: A project team in a maintenance center is working on repairing computers, but they are having difficulty creating a project charter. What is the best description of the problem?
explanation: The work mentioned here is not a project at all. Maintenance work is operational, ongoing and repetitive work, there is no need to create a project charter. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 16

choices.text: They haven’t identified project objectives.
They haven’t identified the product of the project.
The end date has not been set.
They are working on a process and not on a project.

text: A new project manager has just been assigned a construction project that is ongoing and is three weeks behind schedule. The team members are about to be distributed to another new project based on the original time estimates by the functional manager. What type of organization is the new project manager in?
explanation: There is a little authority for a project manager in a centralized (functional) organization. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Hybrid
Balanced matrix
Centralized
Project-oriented

text: A project is being implemented using a predictive approach. There is a high turnover rate for the project team members. More then 50% of the project team members who were assigned at the beginning of the project have left the project and new team members replaced them. The project manager wants to adopt an adaptive approach to accommodate these changes. If his trial is successful, it can be applied on all projects within the organization. What should the project manager do first?
explanation: Before making any change, the project manager needs to evaluate the benefits and the risks for making this change and take the decision accordingly. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 160

choices.text: Ask the team members about their knowledge about agile methodologies.
Evaluate the impacts of moving to adaptive approach.
Schedule a training session for the team members about agile methodologies.
Ensure there is a sufficient budget to make this change.

text: Tom is a project manager at training and consulting company. The company regularly builds teams to create products for clients and train them on those products. When the product is delivered, the team is dissolved and assigned to other projects. What kind of organization is he working for?
explanation: In project-oriented organizations, staff are released after project end and achieving project objectives. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Multi-divisional
Project-oriented
Functional
Strong matrix

text: A large project is being initiated in an organization. The project will be associated with large changes which will impact many departments within the organization. All of the following models can be used by the project manager to transition from the current to the future desired state, except:
explanation: Change models include ADKAR, Virginia Satir, transition model and the 8-step process for leading a change. Cynefin model is a complexity model. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 161-164

choices.text: ADKAR
Virginia Satir
Transition Model
Cynefin

text: Tony and Maxim are two project managers in two different organizations. Tony is usually involved in evaluation and analysis activities prior to project initiation which includes consulting with executive and business unit leaders on ideas for advancing strategic objectives and improving organizational performance. While Maxim is always assigned to manage projects in his organization after the project charter is signed. Which of the following statements best describes this situation?
explanation: The role of a project manager may vary from organization to organization. The project management role is tailored to fit the organization. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 51

choices.text: Tony is more experienced than Maxim, so he is included in evaluation and analysis activities prior to project initiation.
Tony's organization is always looking for advancing their strategic objectives and improving their organizational performance, while Maxim's organization don't.
Both Tony and Maxim perform their roles as project manager each one as specified in his organization.
Tony is performing the role of a portfolio manager, while Maxim is performing his role as a project manager.

text: What could be a PMO role in agile transformation?
explanation: The PMO can help the organization stay on the right side of required compliance needs. Domain = Business Environment. Agile Practice Guide Page 81

choices.text: Providing guidelines to ensure compliance with agile frameworks.
Providing agile tools like Kanban boards and burn charts.
Providing project managers to new agile projects.
Ensuring compliance with standard team velocity.

text: Sam is leading a large project within the organization to switch the manual way of handling customer requests to an automated way. The project is associated with huge changes to organizations systems, employees behaviors and the organization culture as a whole, so it is expected to face a huge resistance from many stakeholders. Which of the following models can he use to transition from the current to the future desired state?
explanation: Many projects contain an aspect of changing systems, behaviors, activities, and sometimes, cultures. Managing this type of change requires thinking about how to transition from the current to the future desired state. There are many models that describe the activities necessary for successful change management like ADKAR model which focuses on five sequential steps that individuals undergo when adapting to change awareness, desire, knowledge, ability and reinforcement.

choices.text: ADKAR
OSCAR
McGregor
Cynefin Framework

text: Due to recent changes in the organization structure, three persons from your project team are going to leave the organization because their positions have become redundant. This has negatively impacted the team members' morale, as the project is progressing well. What should you do as a project manager in this situation?
explanation: The process for leading change for transforming organizations is a top-down approach where the need for and approach to change originates at the top levels of the organization, and then is promoted down through the organization's layers of management to the change recipients. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 7th edition, Page 162

choices.text: Inform the team members that this is the organization's board decision.
Meet with the project team members to discuss the changes and the reasons why it has been undertaken.
Escalate to the project sponsor and let him know how the organization's decision has negatively impacted your project.
Arrange a farewell party for the released team members.

text: Adam recently joined a leading software organization to initiate a project management office. The PMO should have control on all the projects running in the organization and the project managers should report directly to the PMO because the new PMO will be accountable for project success in the organization. Which type of PMO is being initiated here?
explanation: Directive PMOs take control of the projects by directly managing the projects. Project managers are assigned by and report to the PMO. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 48

choices.text: Supportive
Controlling
Directive
Proactive

text: There was a meeting between IT manager and spare parts manager to discuss a major scope change. Your boss is the IT manager. After the meeting your manager contacts you to complete the paper work needed to make the change. This is an example of:
explanation: Here you are a project expediter, because simply you implement what others decided. You didn't evaluate the change or its impacts. Domain = Business Environment. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 47

choices.text: Management attention to scope management
A project expediter position
A change control system
A configuration management system

text: A project has been initiated within an organization to merge two large departments into one department.
